cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River (or about 200 mi SE of Morgan City, Louisiana)
cyclone.trajectory: moving west, forecast to turn WNW tonight then NW on Friday, aiming toward the central Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Morgan City to Intracoastal City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Mouth of the Mississippi River to Cameron, LA; Tropical-Storm Watch east of Pearl River to MS/AL border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm Warning Mouth of Pearl River to Morgan City, LA; Storm-Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River to Shell Beach, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast eastward to the western Florida Panhandle, with greatest impacts expected along the Louisiana and Mississippi coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible late Friday night into Saturday, especially in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation (generally <2 ft) possible during high tide, but no major surge expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could produce 4–8 in of rain with localized higher totals and flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in spiral bands cannot be ruled out.
